position: BCG | INSEAD | P&G | SLB | IIT Kharagpur

positions.subtitle: Procter & Gamble
positions.description: Project Manager | EIMEA Reliability Engineering Leader | Automation Leader (Fabric & Beauty)- Leading over 10 major projects while handling capital > $6 million to enable launch of multiple new initiatives and increase overall sachet platform capacity by 52% for India sub-continent business (India, Sri-Lanka, Bangladesh, Nepal)- Delivered capital optimisation of > $3million by identifying low cost solutions and engineering redesign of existing assets - Spearheading a team of 4 people to develop automation masterplan at 50% cost vs global solutions for Baddi site across Fabric and Beauty business- Selected as the Reliability Engineering Leader for 10 sites across Europe and Asia; Leading a team of 12 people in EIMEA to drive operational excellence via focused improvement action plans to meet Process Reliability (PR) Glidepath- Enabled $1.5 million cost savings annually by executing projects to localise supply chain for 3 SKUs in India in collaboration with Planning, R&D, Finance, Operations and Purchases- Received 'Power of You' award from Global Beauty Senior Vice President for seamless execution of projects to support service requirements at low cost capital solutions
positions.title: Senior Manager
positions.description_html:
Project Manager | EIMEA Reliability Engineering Leader | Automation Leader (Fabric & Beauty)
- Leading over 10 major projects while handling capital > $6 million to enable launch of multiple new initiatives and increase overall sachet platform capacity by 52% for India sub-continent business (India, Sri-Lanka, Bangladesh, Nepal)
- Delivered capital optimisation of > $3million by identifying low cost solutions and engineering redesign of existing assets
- Spearheading a team of 4 people to develop automation masterplan at 50% cost vs global solutions for Baddi site across Fabric and Beauty business
- Selected as the Reliability Engineering Leader for 10 sites across Europe and Asia; Leading a team of 12 people in EIMEA to drive operational excellence via focused improvement action plans to meet Process Reliability (PR) Glidepath
- Enabled $1.5 million cost savings annually by executing projects to localise supply chain for 3 SKUs in India in collaboration with Planning, R&D, Finance, Operations and Purchases
- Received 'Power of You' award from Global Beauty Senior Vice President for seamless execution of projects to support service requirements at low cost capital solutions

positions.subtitle: Procter & Gamble
positions.description: - Project manager of all CAPEX projects and initiatives for P&G Beauty Care business in India- Led a $2.7 million project for installation of a new technology platform for localising conditioner business in India to deliver incremental revenues of $10 million annually- Revamped Pantene SKU for entire Indian market through engineering redesign of tube filling platform; Delivered capital optimisation of 1 million via repurposing of existing assets - Delivered 40% capacity increase across entire sachet lines in collaboration with OEM to support growing business projections and $90,000/yr savings- Qualified as Intermediate Project Manager within 1.5 years by clearing all requirements as per P&G internal standards
positions.title: Manager
positions.description_html:
- Project manager of all CAPEX projects and initiatives for P&G Beauty Care business in India
- Led a $2.7 million project for installation of a new technology platform for localising conditioner business in India to deliver incremental revenues of $10 million annually
- Revamped Pantene SKU for entire Indian market through engineering redesign of tube filling platform; Delivered capital optimisation of 1 million via repurposing of existing assets
- Delivered 40% capacity increase across entire sachet lines in collaboration with OEM to support growing business projections and $90,000/yr savings
- Qualified as Intermediate Project Manager within 1.5 years by clearing all requirements as per P&G internal standards

experience.title: Field Engineer
experience.description: - Spearheaded a team of 20 people to execute coiled tubing operations to increase crude oil throughput for 3 clients across 4 states- Technical lead for onsite projects in North East India geography generating $4M revenue annually- Successfully completed an intensive 3 months training school in Abu Dhabi with a cumulative score of 95%; ranked 3rd in a school of 20 people from 10 different countries

experience.title: Internship
experience.description: - Analysed and calculated forex penetration of Axis Bank across different industrial sectors and exporting regions- Identified two major industrial sectors and two major exporting clusters with scope of increased forex revenues- Analysed revenues, adjusted exposure and probability of default to determine top 10 corporate clients within RAROC framework
experience.description_html: - Analysed and calculated forex penetration of Axis Bank across different industrial sectors and exporting regions- Identified two major industrial sectors and two major exporting clusters with scope of increased forex revenues- Analysed revenues, adjusted exposure and probability of default to determine top 10 corporate clients within RAROC framework <!---->

experience.title: Summer Intern
experience.description: -Worked as a research intern on the project "Kinetic Modelling of reaction networks generated in the pyrolysis of renewables" at the Laboratory of Chemical Technology in Ghent University, Belgium.-Amongst 5 interns from India to be awarded Visiting Student Scholarship worth INR 4 Lakhs for the internship program-Performed pyrolysis of 5 alcohols on bench scale setup to analyse products formed on gcxgc(2 dimensional gas chromatography) ï€ -Modelled various reaction pathways involved in product formation on pyrolysis of butanol, ethanol using GENESYS(software) ï€ -Established 60% reduction in coke formation on applying SiO2/S coating in cracking of hydrocarbons in pilot plant ï€
experience.description_html: -Worked as a research intern on the project "Kinetic Modelling of reaction networks generated in the pyrolysis of renewables" at the Laboratory of Chemical Technology in Ghent University, Belgium.-Amongst 5 interns from India to be awarded Visiting Student Scholarship worth INR 4 Lakhs for the internship program-Performed pyrolysis of 5 alcohols on bench scale setup to analyse products formed on gcxgc(2 dimensional gas chromatography) ï€ -Modelled various reaction pathways involved in product formation on pyrolysis of butanol, ethanol using GENESYS(software) ï€ -Established 60% reduction in coke formation on applying SiO2/S coating in cracking of hydrocarbons in pilot plant ï€

projects: [{"title":"Diffusion in Composite Films","start_date":"May 2015","end_date":"Apr 2016","description":"-Developed mathematical model for solute release for homogenous and heterogeneous gel systems composed of alginate-Implemented Maxwell Garnett Theory to successfully treat a composite medium as a homogenous one and plot the drug's concentration profile as a function of time and the radial distance-Estimated diffusivity coefficients of voids and matrix for both types of gel systems by simulating the model in MATLAB"}]
